reviews.sentence: Location was great for our stay. Close to the sprint center. I would have liked to see a small complementary breakfast bar.

Pleasant stay in downtown KC. We used the Expedia service where you select the level of hotel and they assign the hotel after booking. Although the Crowne Plaza has had some negative reviews recently we were thoroughly pleased with our stay. The room was large and comfortable and well appointed as was the bathroom. The staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful. We did not use other facilities and so can not comment on them. The hotel is situated about 2 blocks from the Power and Light District and so it was very easy to walk over for dinner and entertainment. There is construction on the exterior going on but it was not intrusive and started only after 9 am and ended before 5 pm. Additionally we were pleased to see that Wifi was free. Valet parking was 17 and included multiple uses during the day. We would definitely stay here again on the next trip to KC.

The staff was amazing. So friendly and helpful. The lobby hallways and rooms were very clean. The location was awesome. Within walking distance of shops restaurants and bar. Near sprint center PL districtI stayed in a suite it had 2 very spacious rooms. My only complaint was around 5 am the air conditioner went out and our room got extremely warm. Luckily the unit in the bedroom worked but we still left early due to our discomfort in the temperature. Location was awesome the views from our room were fantastic. The staff was friendly. The bed was comfortable. There is a great coffee shop in the lobby which is so convenient. We will definitely return again sometime.

Great location in the Power and Light District nice view rooftop pool although it closes earlyPor customer service. Shuttle was at the airport at when requested at 120 and told was unavailable. Staff seemed unconcerned about this when informed. Shuttle was later seen picking up guests at 1245 from the hotel even though the end time is 120.
Staff and proximity to the wedding we went to. Very small bathroom.

Nice place to stay in downtown. Nice hotel that is very convenient to downtown PL district. Our room was clean spacious and offered a neat view of the city. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were fresh and clean. Staff was attentive and courteous to all our needs requests. My only complaint was the dreaded valet parking. It took a long time for us to get our vehicle especially at checkout on Sunday morning. There were 3 valets working but it was just not enough to keep up with demand.

Just OK hotel with awesome location. Wanted to stay in power and light district and went with the Crowne. Nothing really special about it besides the killer location to everything in the power and light district. It is an older hotel that has been updated but probably awhile back. Big room with above average bed but small bathroom. Staff was helpful at check in. If it were not for the location I would have rated it lower.

Great location really nice stay. Location location location. Near Power Light District Sprint Center theatre restaurants and bars. Also only 1 mile from West Bottoms. Such a fun cityCheck in was fast and easy. Staff was super friendly and helpful. We were able to easily switch from 2quen room to a king suite. Extra space was awesome. Noticed some spots with bathroom that could have used more attention in cleaning but nothing else noticed in the room. Really nice place.

Good access and close proximity to Sprint Center Bartle Hall and Power Light District. but hotel was just ok. Rooms could have been cleaner bedding was just ok. Would have preferred the Mariot down the street.

Great location and staff. Reliable hotel. with a great helpful staff. Quenton at the front desk was particularly helpful and friendly and this sets a great tone for the hotel. The rooms were large and clean although the bathrooms were a bit small. The breakfasts were nice and offered a good variety but the restaurant hours were a bit limited. However this hotel is in a great location near tons of restaurants and a wonderful market so there were lots of food choices. Great location near the Convention Center and Sprint Center and the shuttle drivers went out of their way to make sure guests could get where they needed to go. I would definitely stay here again when visiting this area.

Outstanding Hotel. This is an outstanding hotel. We were here for four days and from check in to check out this staff goes above and beyond in customer satisfaction. Sherry checked us in and gave us a great room. She also told us about the free shuttle they have. Which you can take to go to places in the downtown area. One of the shuttle drivers was Daryl who not only provided fast and safe rides but he also had great knowledge of the city which really made our stay.

Downtown Hotel. Just stayed 4 nights at the Crowne Plaza in KC Downtown. It is overpriced for the quality of this location. It is conveniently located downtown and we chose it as it is close to our sons apartment. However it is in need of a deep cleaning and a freshening. Our room rate fluctuated from 239 the first night to 29 our fourth night. Our experience did not improve by 60. The lobby area is noisy with background music as well as conversation so although the staff is helpful communication is challenging when staff does not speak up. Our room number was written so illegibly by the desk clerk we had to call downstairs after check in to ask what room we were in. Carpeting in the hallway is filthy with large stains and in need of replacement. Several times trash bags of trash or dirty linens were just sitting in the hallway. Our room was small as was the bathroom. Functional but not luxury or worth 29. The bathroom floor was in need of a scrubbing and the same eyelash was on our toilet tank our entire stay. There is a fridge but no mini bar. The air conditioner was very noisey and during the night you could hear the whir of the elevator. The staff is polite and tries to be helpful although they could not explain the procedure for the Super Shuttle I reserved. As they recommended it they should familiarize themselves with the procedure. Overall it was an average hotel stay. Cable went out twice during a rainstorm. Next visit I will the Mariot 2 blocks away.

Good location to power and light district. Good location near power and light district but could definitely use some upgrades and a little facelift. A little pricey for what you get but I guess it is more about location that I am paying for that was a good hotel overall.

Fan Bearings Cold Drafts and Noisy Otis. oh my. My wife and I decided to stay downtown for an event at Municipal and since it was going to be 12 degrees out we went with this hotel. We showed up early to check in before going to dinner with friends. The parking garage was almost full but we found a spot and waited about 10 minutes for the garage elevator. We made it to the front desk before dinner and were given the keys to our carnival ride for the evening. Room 1916One of the keys worked and one did not. Score. We walked into the room and the heater in the bedroom of our king suite was screeching like a rail car with a bad bearing we could not talk over it. My guess is that it is intermittent and the room attendants do not hear it when they come in during the mid day hours. We were pressed for time so I shut it down instead of asking for another room. After dinner we came back to a packed parking garage and a line of folks waiting for the valets. They were shuttling back and forth down the block to a lot and did a good job of managing the volume for just two guys. The show finished up and we headed back to the room. The seals around the perimeter of the heating units leaks like a sieve. Half of the room was 70 and the other half was not really close to that. Getting the heater going again revealed that rest did not fix the screech. Joy. The interesting part about it was that the screeching did cover the Curly 3 Stooges style whopwhopwhop that the old Otis elevator made with every move. The lobby and entrance were nice. All of downtown KC is nearby. Fix the old Otis elevators. Fix and seal the heating units.
The rooms were extremely nice as were the staff. They had a free shuttle to take you anywhere around town.

Some good some bad. The hotel lobby had been refreshed since our last stay a few years ago. It was fairly clean the hallways could use some sprucing up but I have seen worse. We filled out our room services door hanger early in the night 7 pm and it was never picked up. We were able to eat in the resturant which had a great menu posted only you could only have buffet. We did have a great shuttle driver who told us about the buildings as we drove by.

Amazing Experience. First off I have stayed in a hotel anywhere from 1 5 times a week for the last 10 years. By far this was the most welcoming I have ever gotten out of any hotel across the country. A HUGE shout out to both Shawnte and Denise for the unbelievable welcome and the excitement to stay on this property. We came here for my wifes birthday and they went way above and beyond to make sure it was unforgettable weekend. Thank you both Sawnte and Denise and always keep it turned up. The property itself just gives the hospitality feeling you look for as soon as you walk in the door. Location is awesome as we look out our window and see the Power and Light District right below us. If you do not want to walk it they have a shuttle running until 1PM. Bottom Line. If your looking for an AMAZING EXPERIENCE as soon as you walk in to the front desk to check in to the time you leave. this is your place.

Stay away. First review I have ever written for a hotel. We were highly disappointed with our one night stay. Thank goodness it was only one night. Two words that come to mind are filth and rude. The place needs a good scrubbing. Everything from the carpets water fountains and elevator doors looked absolutey filthy like no one has bothered to clean them for a long time. Even the womans blouse who checked us in looked filthy. Unbelievable wash your clothes before you show up to work. The room had a smell of feet. Overall the customer service was the worst I have ever experienced and I travel often for work. Staff flat out ignored us. we were the only people at the counter and they looked past us. When I asked for they are assistance they seemed bothered were rude and raised they voice questioning me as if I had done something wrong. I had to raise my voice to snap them out of it. When I tried to check out there was a different man at the counter and he also flat out ignored me even though I was the only person there saying excuse me. While this hotel was a little cheaper we paid an extra fifty bucks for the Westin Downtown WHAT A DIFFERENCE. Do yourself a favor avoid the CROWN PLAZA.

Had to ask to have room cleaned. They are doing some renovations and we awoke to the sounds of hammering both mornings. Also wanted to use the shuttle but they would not guarantee it would be available. We were going to a wedding just a block away and needed to be on time. Overall poor customer service.
Currently under a major renovation but it is the only place we stayed in downtown KC.

The location was great and the room was fine. There was a lot of construction going on in front of the hotel which was not their fault but in the only lane leading to the parking garage was one of their shuttle vans blocking most of the lane. When I brought this issue to the front desk after squeezing by the van with help from a construction worker I was snapped at by the front desk associate and told that is where it stays.
